definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: But small auctions can lead to low winning bids, and thus less profit.
sentences.chinese: 此外，小型拍卖会导致中标价过低，利润从而减少。

sentences.english: I'm afraid the prices are fixed in this store.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能讲价，本店是明码标价。

sentences.english: What's more, the price should be clearly marked.
sentences.chinese: 更重要的是，应明码标价。

sentences.english: There’s nothing fancy here but there is really good food that is very reasonably priced.
sentences.chinese: 这里无什么独到之处，但确实是有标价便宜的美食呢。

sentences.english: Price in Swiss Franc (CHF or SFr), Tax included.
The price of every item on sale will be displayed.
sentences.chinese: 每一件出售商品的价格都是明码标价。

sentences.english: Because even the smallest favors carries a price tag.
sentences.chinese: 因为就算是最小的帮忙，都明码标价。

sentences.english: But when you’re shopping at a charity store, pay the sticker price.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果在慈善店里买东西的话，按标价付费吧。

sentences.english: The suggested bribery prices for hospitals in different cities are publicized on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 互联网上公布了中国各个城市医院的贿赂标价。

sentences.english: That suggests a sticker price of at least $30, 000 before taxes for a mid-range version.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着一个中等版本的车税前标价至少为三万美元。

sentences.english: Perhaps the experience is well worth the three-figure priced tag.
sentences.chinese: 也可能这个体验值它3位数的标价。

sentences.english: These dealers resell the coins, which now fetch about $815.
sentences.chinese: 这些经销商零售金币，现在标价大约为$815。

sentences.english: Retailers shall clearly mark prices on the commodities provided by them.
sentences.chinese: 商店提供商品应当明码标价。

sentences.english: Exhibition pieces should not be labeled for price or have relation with any other methods of commercial behavior.
sentences.chinese: 展出作品不得有标价及其他方式之商业行为。

sentences.english: That kind of optimism is hard for underwriters to price ahead of time. So is scarcity value.
sentences.chinese: 因为这种乐观主义而让承销商来提前标价是困难的。

sentences.english: She also says that customers are scrutinizing the price tags on shoes before trying them on.
sentences.chinese: 她还说，顾客在试穿鞋子之前都要先仔细看看标价。

definition: asking price/to ask a price/to demand terms (in negotiations)
to quote a price/seller's first offer
to set a price/to fix a price
